content: crabby version a-1 january 6 2007 materials needed -any worsted weight yarn approx 2 oz red and a small amount of natural i used ltk s 3-ply -g hook or hook needed to obtain gauge -stuffing of your choice this can be wool roving polyester fiberfill fabric scraps of yarn…use your imagination -tapestry needle and stitch marker gauge 4 75 sts and 4 5 row per inch in single_crochet body nd round 1 w/ red chain 2 8 single_crochet in 2 chain from hook join w/ slip_stitch 8 single_crochet round 2 chain 1 2 single_crochet in ea st around join w/ slip_stitch 16 single_crochet round 3 chain 1 single_crochet in next single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next st around join w/ slip_stitch 24 single_crochet round 4 chain 1 single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next st around join w/ slip_stitch 32 single_crochet round 5 chain 1 single_crochet in next 3 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next st around join w/ slip_stitch 40 single_crochet round 6 working in front loops only chain 1 single_crochet in next 4 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next st around join w/ slip_stitch 48 single_crochet round 7 chain 1 insert hook in back loop of the 1st single_crochet from the previous round and make a single_crochet single_crochet in ea back loop around join w/ slip_stitch 40 single_crochet rnds 8-9 chain 1 working through both loops single_crochet in ea single_crochet around join w/ slip_stitch round 10 chain 1 single_crochet in next 3 st single_crochet decrease around join w/ slip_stitch 32 single_crochet round 11 chain 1 single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet single_crochet decrease around join w/ slip_stitch 24 single_crochet round 12 chain 1 single_crochet in next single_crochet single_crochet decrease around join w/ slip_stitch 16 single_crochet round 13 chain 1 single_crochet decrease around join w/ slip_stitch 8 single_crochet stuff w/ filling of your choice round 14 chain 1 single_crochet decrease around join w/ slip_stitch 4 single_crochet finish off eyes make 2 nd row 1 eye stem w/ red chain 3 single_crochet in the back ridge of the 2 chain from hook and the next chain 2 single_crochet finish off leaving a 6 tail or transmitted in any form or by any means electronic mechanical photocopying recording or otherwise without the prior written permission of patti gonsalves persons interested in a commercial license may contact patti gonsalves at dandelions2@yahoo com or http \\www dandeliondreamers com for further information page 1 of 1 row 2 eye ball w/ natural join w/ single_crochet to the end of the eye stem 3 single_crochet in the same space as join 4 single_crochet remove the hook insert hook into the first single_crochet pick up loop from the last single_crochet and pull through finish off sew to body see picture for placement repeat for 2nd eye claws make 2 w/ red chain
